name: politico
text: As states reopen, some are reporting record-breaking Covid-19 cases and hospitalizations. @POLITICOPro’s team of policy reporters are working around the clock to track these developments and more. Follow along here https://t.co/DpGlCNd8T2

name: politico
text:
Charles Booker’s late surge in Kentucky is threatening to prematurely end the campaign of one of the Democratic Party's top recruits on Tuesday: former fighter pilot Amy McGrath

https://t.co/QvmLiTylNq

name: politico
text:
After the initial Covid outbreak, Washington became one of the early examples of a state that successfully bent the curve: Daily deaths have been below 10 since May, from a peak of 34 at the end of March.

Case counts were also on the downswing — until now
https://t.co/FpFL9BRA0c

name: politico
text:
Senate Republicans today defended Trump over his removal of the top federal prosecutor in Manhattan, whose office was investigating the president’s associates before his abrupt firing over the weekend

https://t.co/SKnHeOuMCS

name: politico
text:
The House Judiciary Committee is preparing to subpoena Attorney General William Barr.

Barr has yet to testify before the committee since taking his post early last year.

https://t.co/7Hga9TCqd3

name: politico
text:
The U.S. on Tuesday will return the remains of 147 South Korean soldiers who went missing during the Korean War.

The repatriation ceremony marks the largest such effort to date
https://t.co/FumrG9C731

text:

But many are struggling to stay afloat amid confusion and delays over the federal bailout for the health care industry
https://t.co/X9LtsJVn5H

name: politico
text:

So far, it’s not going well
https://t.co/TYrz7LUzGA

text: White House officials are putting a target on the CDC, positioning the agency as a coronavirus scapegoat as cases surge in many states https://t.co/62uWU6RLWe

name: politico
text: If Joe Biden wins in November, much of his agenda will hinge on a potentially surprising power-player: Chris Coons https://t.co/hQMFvQ67Rz

name: politico
text:
Primaries in Kentucky and New York offer liberals significant opportunities to grow their influence in the party.

Here are 9 things to watch for in today's races: https://t.co/EC2NE0DfTr

name: politico
text: John Bolton’s book is titled “In the Room Where It Happened,” but White House officials are eager to paint a different picture — that he wasn’t always there https://t.co/gd8RHLOmwb

name: politico
text: In 2020, President Donald Trump has found reusable scapegoats for the parade of crises that have afflicted the country — governors https://t.co/S4incx4Ooi

name: politico
text: Bernie Sanders' efforts in Tuesday's primaries provide a glimpse into how he sees his role in advancing the progressive movement after ending his presidential bid in April https://t.co/5PFjsn0J8H

name: politico
text: President Trump’s plan to nominate SEC Chairman Jay Clayton to be the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York is running into trouble before it's even gotten off the ground https://t.co/9dRwRV8vlO

name: politico
text: President Trump kicked up a firestorm this weekend for ousting the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who was looking into some of his associates. But now Trump’s getting cover from a predictable source: congressional Republicans. https://t.co/suA0Or7euQ

name: politico
text:
Charles Booker’s late surge in Kentucky is threatening to prematurely end the campaign of one of the Democratic Party's top recruits today: former fighter pilot Amy McGrath.

But he's still an underdog to pull the major upset. https://t.co/8qSdWYMLsT

name: politico
text: Booker’s burst in the final stretch of the primary came after McGrath spent nearly a year running what essentially amounted to a general election campaign against Sen. Mitch McConnell https://t.co/8qSdWYMLsT

name: politico
text: If McGrath wins — most Democrats tracking the race think she remains the favorite — it will be another bitter defeat for the left wing of the party, which is also seeking victories in several House primaries  https://t.co/8qSdWYMLsT https://t.co/deJCtC20XJ

name: politico
text: If Booker manages to pull it off, it would be the first primary defeat for a candidate backed by the Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee in a decade https://t.co/8qSdWYMLsT https://t.co/F1QRjy1A5K

name: politico
text: McGrath's campaign has spent more than $12 million on TV so far, compared with just $1.3 million for Booker, who did not start advertising on TV until the second week in June, according to data from Advertising Analytics https://t.co/8qSdWYMLsT

name: politico
text: A major factor creating uncertainty is voting changes because of the pandemic. The state allowed all voters to request absentee ballots but also limited in-person voting stations, including just one polling location in Jefferson County https://t.co/8qSdWYMLsT https://t.co/44fWyLVIvn

name: politico
text: Regardless of who emerges as the nominee, defeating McConnell will clearly be an uphill climb in a state that hasn’t elected a Democrat to the Senate in three decades. But the approaches would be very different https://t.co/8qSdWYMLsT

name: politico
text: President Donald Trump suggested that former national security adviser John Bolton should be jailed for publishing his White House memoir https://t.co/Kj1tU7MSmY

name: politico
text: American whiskey distillers have lost more than $250 million in sales over the past two years due to the EU’s retaliatory tariffs in response to President Trump’s duties on imported steel and aluminum, a new report shows https://t.co/HHbey5rzUw

name: politico
text: We have a jam-packed primary day, even if we likely won’t know the winners of hotly-contested primaries in New York and Kentucky tonight. Here’s our guide to the biggest races of the day 👇https://t.co/oyIpLnRZUt

name: politico
text: New York’s elections have entered completely uncharted waters — the primary calendar was changed, as was the method of casting and counting ballots. The winning candidates are likely to be those best able to navigate these changes. https://t.co/3mIGHm7cbW
